title.narrative: 1.3 ROLLOUT COMMON ACCOUNTABILITY AFFECTED POPULATIONS APPROACH.

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Technical Excellence In Humanitarian Action. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF is committed to ensuring that vulnerable, at-risk and crisis-affected people, including children, women and the most vulnerable groups supported through UNICEF&39;s actions, can hold UNICEF to account for promoting and protecting their rights and generating effective results for them. This is achieved with a significant investment in ensuring UNICEF Country Offices are equipped with the necessary guidance and receive relevant technical support. By the end of 2021, 47 Country Offices had received dedicated technical support on Accountability to Affected Populations (AAP) in the last 24 months. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:23/03/2022

title.narrative: of HAC COs supported (remote, mission, learning, and/or surge) to systematically use feedback & complaint mechanisms to inform corrective action to be taken by relevant UNICEF senior management/HCTs(61060)

target.value: 2021:20 HAC COs systematically use feedback & complaint mechanisms to inform corrective action to be taken by relevant UNICEF senior management/HCTs

title.narrative: An agreed organization-wide framework for AAP in humanitarian programming is adopted and disseminated throughout UNICEF, and with UNICEF-led clusters and AoRs(61059)

baseline.value: A draft organization-wide framework is under development, but not yet adopted, and requires additional guidance and tools

target.value: 2021:AAP is fully mainstreamed in all UNICEF programmes

title.narrative: of activated UNICEF-led clusters and AoRs and/or sector coordination mechanisms supported (remote, missions, learning, and/or surge) to integrate common AAP approaches to improve quality, coverage and cluster performance(61061)

baseline.value: Limited AAP support has been provided to UNICEF-led clusters and AoRs in 4-5 crises, but this has not been systematic

target.value: 2021:At least 12 UNICEF clusters/AoRs integrating common AAP approaches

title.narrative: of global strategic partnerships for system-wide surge capacity on AAP/CCE(61063)

baseline.value: None currently exist, but work underway with existing stand-by partners to expand their AAP/CCE rosters

target.value: 2021:Requests for AAP/CCE support met by standby partners

title.narrative: of priority HAC COs and UNICEF clusters supported (remote, mission, learning, and/or surge) by EMOPS to implement AAP /CCE capacity building for local actors(61062)

target.value: 2021:At least 10 HAC COs/UNICEF Clusters/AoRs have initiated AAP capacity development initiatives

actual.value: 2021:at least 24 HAC Cos received technical support

title.narrative: of priority HAC COs and UNICEF clusters supported (remote, mission, learning, and/or surge) by EMOPS to implement AAP /CCE capacity building for local actors(61062)

target.value: 2021:At least 10 HAC COs/UNICEF Clusters/AoRs have initiated AAP capacity development initiatives

actual.value: 2021:at least 24 HAC Cos received technical support
